Message.Title: WOW.
Message.Msg: Did anybody remember the "ground zero" letter about 2 years ago? Amazon just released their quarter numbers and missing both top and bottom line. The stock dropped like 5% after hours. All analysts, of course, were having a great time predicting a blood bath for Amazon for the next trading day. Then, the "ground zero" letter from Jeff B hit the wire before the opening and Amazon JUMPED. Did it have any help from the market makers or now, I wish I knew. Nonetheless, Amazon actually ended the day up like 5%. That letter made a $10Billion difference! I have been trying to persuade my son to study writing essays instead of writing programs ever since. So, buy when Jeff B's letter is out, at least for a short time. Ignore this insight to your own peril.

Message.Title: Troubling signs from Amazon coming into reporting season
Message.Msg: Two interesting items this week: 1. In his letter to shareholders Jeffy "noted that the brand reputation will continue to outweigh short-term swings in Amazon’s stock-price". This sounds like Jeffy thinks there might be come trouble coming soon in the (ridiculous) AMZN stock price. 2. Amazon increases Executive salaries. Amazon has been letting the AMZN longs pay his top executives by using stock options since Amazon started. Up to now this has been a good strategy because the stock price has gone nothing by up. To start paying them in salary is only going to hurt earnings, which last year weren't very good. If I were an AMZN long, I would start to wonder what these two items mean with 1Q13 earnings coming in about 2 weeks.

Message.Title: AMZN is like a "rare collectible" that is intriinsically worthless...
Message.Msg: It became "rare" because "everyone else" dumped it into the hands of a very few people who now "own it all." And because those very few people who own it all also have a lot of money, and it's not even their money, they can now vault AMZN to increasing price levels by way of offering increasing bids on it between themselves without actually having to buy (much) of it between themselves. In other words, they can simply trade it upwards between themselves to make it go up without having to worry that (most) anyone else is going to actually sell any to them. That's how certain collectibles that are intrinsically worthless got to be "worth" a lot of money in the first place. And thus, the owners have "proven" to all outsiders that it is not the "intrinsic worth" of an item (i.e. fundamentals) that mean anything vis a vis its "current trading value." Rather it is in the owners ability to manipulate the price higher. And thus, they have proven that all outsiders need such owners to make all of their collectibles/stocks "worth" more (i.e. one cannot make them worth more on one's own, and neither can the thing itself---i.e. the underlying company in question---can do anything to cause the "stock" to be "worth" more). Great. I'm thoroughly convinced. Now here, take all of my money and make my "stocks" go "up." At least on paper.

Topic.Title: What's amazing is to see gold crash at a time where Central Banks have ratcheted up paper moeny printing

Message.Msg: Bottom line: ALL "investments" are pretty much of a scam. Gold, silver, etc., did practically nothing in terms of price movement for MANY MANY years. Then, all of a sudden, in a matter of roughly ten years, it got bid from under $300/ounce to nearly $2000! And oil from about $10/barrel in 1999 to over $100/barrel in 2007, then tanking back to $30's soon thereafter, then back up to $100+ soon thereafter! And with all of the so-called daily excuses following each rise and fall. All of those "reasons" are just after-the-fact excuses. We know that, you know that. Too obvious. But at least with collectibles, the buyer/owner is keeping himself busy with a "hobby." So there's some possible benefit with that (just don't tell any of the owners who paid $300 for Libearty the Beanie baby that...).

Topic.Title: Bots gotta steer this thing just right to murder optionz crackheadz

Message.Msg: Sammy, Looks like old sybs needz to educate you some more. Sybil wouldnt dare write optionz, only those with robots and gobs of other peoplez money that can take down a statistically significant portion of the underlying float can successfully write optionz and consistantly win... They day a retailer writes a put thinking "hey, if the trading housez do it then so can i !" Will be the day that robots gobble up those mispriced put optionz written by retailerz and UN FVCKIN LOAD their position and then put that retailer to the optionz they stupidly wrote.... You need some lessonz... If you go to a card table not knowing who the patsy iz then your the patsy bro..... Good luck.

Message.Title: Circle time story telling with Jeff iz just around the corner
Message.Msg: Sybs cant wait, because hiz storiez are very creative and entertaining. Jeff gets paid very well for hiz good story telling by the camp fire.... He gets paid in advance before he tellz storiez and he gets paid afterwardz az he UNLOADZ gobs of free stock given to him in the form of optionz az fido, ms, and cap world say "tell us more and will throw more baggie held equity sharez at you to dilute. Tell us jeff. Tell us another good story... One of revenue growth - thats our fav... we also like reed'z storiez of subs growth... great stuff jeff". in q4 old jeffy cashed in 200 million of hiz excersised immediate to sell stok optionz for great storiez, so that the amzn board could "attract and retain the most skillful leadership talent to strategically implement and execute amzn's business plan".... Whats amzn's business plan again? Oh right they are a central source for on line books, now wait they are a cloud computing company through the mystical AWS, hold on they are an on line retailer to take out bby, wmt, and tgt, hold on .... Arent they a massive logistics center with a global distribution mkt? Wait, sybs got it now - they are an on line movie provider and content writer to take on cable, nflx and dish... Whoa wait a second, they are a tablet maker here to bury aapl and samsung, no amzn iz a global software servicez company ready to take out orcl, hold on they are an intiligenxe network arm of the cia, hold on they are a retail banking co issuing its own line of credit cardz..... Believe it or not, they have stated at one time or another all of these thingz they are, and more.... seemz They are everything except for a company that makes money in excess of its expensez.... Interesting.
